alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 10:49AM PDT until April 25 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Comus affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Comus...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Comus. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Minor lowland flooding throughout the reach. No flooding in Winnemucca. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM PDT Monday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is currently in minor flood stage and is expected to remain in minor flood stage through Wednesday morning. River levels are expected to decrease Wednesday afternoon through Thursday. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 06/13/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1045 AM PDT.
